alert.note: Alert for Borden; Howard; Mitchell; Scurry (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued February 26 at 6:41PM CST until February 26 at 8:15PM CST by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Midland has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... Mitchell County in western Texas... Scurry County in western Texas... Borden County in western Texas... Howard County in western Texas... * Until 815 PM CST. * At 640 PM CST, a dust channel was 7 miles west of Colorado City Airport, or 13 miles northwest of Colorado City, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility with damaging wind in excess of 60 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes Interstate 20 between mile markers 164 and 228. Locations impacted include... Big Spring, Snyder, Colorado City, Gail, Coahoma, Loraine, Forsan, Sand Springs, Lomax, Lake Colorado City, Lake Colorado City State Park, Inadale, Luther, Fluvanna, Colorado City Airport, J B Thomas Reservoir, Champion Creek Reservoir, Westbrook, Cuthbert and Dunn. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
